text:
What's the recommended way of dealing with
"Does not meet sequential version number guideline: version 0.3.2 skips over 0.3.0"? The package had a tag 0.3.0 that was not registered. Is rewriting the git history the only option?

I'm asking in the context of <https://github.com/dextorious/NumericalIntegration.jl/issues/29> and <https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/26861>

cc <@U6K14KE4F>

elements.text:
What's the recommended way of dealing with
"Does not meet sequential version number guideline: version 0.3.2 skips over 0.3.0"? The package had a tag 0.3.0 that was not registered. Is rewriting the git history the only option?

I'm asking in the context of

text: you don't have to rewrite the git history, only delete the tag and reregister v0.3.0.  it's also ok to say "I'm happy to jump directly to 0.3.2", but do say something about how to procede, otherwise no one will do anything and the PR will be automatically closed

elements.text: you don't have to rewrite the git history, only delete the tag and reregister v0.3.0.  it's also ok to say "I'm happy to jump directly to 0.3.2", but do say something about how to procede, otherwise no one will do anything and the PR will be automatically closed
